channel.title: @hyperdbg - Telegram group archive
channel.description: Public archive of HyperDbg Telegram messages.

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 17:02:14+00:00 (#5722)
item.description: would be nice to know if there was a difference at all

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 17:01:27+00:00 (#5721)
item.description: and I don't think we've heard back re: the latest changes from the person who still saw this issue on their machine, even though it was fixed on mine/ours?

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 16:59:39+00:00 (#5720)
item.description: I'm not at all familiar with memory caching related stuff really, I was mainly focusing on getting my machine to no longer hang and even that was quite enough work

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 16:57:29+00:00 (#5719)
item.description: yes, very true

item.title: @hikawaruriwo on 2024-01-28 16:52:03+00:00 (#5718)
item.description: If the overlapping regions (UC, MT, and MB) are correctly handled during the MTRR initialization, and regions of the same type are merged, it would enhance the speed of the GetMemoryType function and also prevent unnecessary large page splits in certain scenarios. Of course, this is a suggestion related to optimization and is optional.

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 13:24:25+00:00 (#5717)
item.description:
HyperDbg v0.8 is released!
# [0.8.0.0] - 2024-01-28 New release of the HyperDbg Debugger thanks to @Mattiwatti.
# Changed - Fix miscalculating MTRRs in 13th gen processors
# Added - The !mode event command is added to detect kernel-to-user and user-to-kernel transitions https://docs.hyperdbg.org/commands/extension-commands/mode
- The 'preactivate' command is added to support initializing special functionalities in the Debugger Mode https://docs.hyperdbg.org/commands/debugging-commands/preactivate

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 12:31:32+00:00 (#5716)
item.description: üëç

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 12:31:13+00:00 (#5715)
item.description: PR made

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 12:20:13+00:00 (#5714)
item.description: on it

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 12:20:10+00:00 (#5713)
item.description: alright

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 12:19:57+00:00 (#5712)
item.description: yes, go for it

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 12:19:39+00:00 (#5711)
item.description: I can make a new PR that includes both commits?

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 12:19:32+00:00 (#5710)
item.description: that also reverts the indexing PR I made earlier

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 12:19:11+00:00 (#5709)
item.description: question - what do you want me to put in the PR? I saw that you made a revert commit in dev

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 12:18:45+00:00 (#5708)
item.description: Great

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 12:18:31+00:00 (#5707)
item.description: OK, I've tested the change and load vmm works on my 13th gen, both physically and in vmware

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:54:41+00:00 (#5706)
item.description: ü´°üòé

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:54:35+00:00 (#5705)
item.description: we'll release it once you finished it

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:54:25+00:00 (#5704)
item.description: go for it

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:54:23+00:00 (#5703)
item.description: If it's less than an hour then it's pretty fine

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:54:01+00:00 (#5702)
item.description: but either is fine by me

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:53:52+00:00 (#5701)
item.description: OK, well that's up to you of course - but this should take me less than half an hour

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:52:56+00:00 (#5700)
item.description: So, please create PR once everything was fine with that. I'll go for v0.8 now and later once the next PR is ready we could release v0.8.1

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:52:02+00:00 (#5699)
item.description: but I still need to make the correct change on top of the current dev branch, without any unrelated stuff in it, and then test it to verify

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:51:10+00:00 (#5698)
item.description: so I'm pretty confident it will be fine

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:51:02+00:00 (#5697)
item.description: well, I've removed the SMRR logic before and had no issues on 13th gen

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:50:53+00:00 (#5696)
item.description: I also made a couple of tests on my 12 gen machine and it seems to be fine

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:50:33+00:00 (#5695)
item.description: right now, we need to make sure that HyperDbg loads on 13th gen machine, which it seems to be fine

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:50:12+00:00 (#5694)
item.description: We could fix it on next versions

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:49:57+00:00 (#5693)
item.description: I do need to actually test that heh

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:49:49+00:00 (#5692)
item.description: yes, exactly

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:49:40+00:00 (#5691)
item.description: as long as it doesn't cause loading issue.

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:49:27+00:00 (#5690)
item.description: Ah, that's okay

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:49:17+00:00 (#5689)
item.description: I was testing for issues in vmware thus far

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:48:43+00:00 (#5688)
item.description: well, if you mean literally right now, - I still need to make a commit to remove the 'SMRR is an MTRR' logic üòÖ

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:47:58+00:00 (#5687)
item.description: https://docs.hyperdbg.org/commands/extension-commands/mode

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:47:37+00:00 (#5686)
item.description: to fix 13th gen loading problem as well as the !mode command.

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:47:17+00:00 (#5685)
item.description: So, we're probably good to release v0.8

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:46:59+00:00 (#5684)
item.description: there's no issue with loading the VMM itself

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:46:59+00:00 (#5683)
item.description: It doesn't crash for me, but yes it should be something silly

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:46:39+00:00 (#5682)
item.description: that has to be something simple/silly though

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:46:20+00:00 (#5681)
item.description: the user mode crash after .debug close does reproduce every time though

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:45:54+00:00 (#5680)
item.description: i.e. loading the vmm works

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:45:37+00:00 (#5679)
item.description: 4 attempts in so far - this does not seem to happen for me

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:37:38+00:00 (#5678)
item.description: roger

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:37:36+00:00 (#5677)
item.description: just clarifying the purpose, I guess

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:37:31+00:00 (#5676)
item.description: yes

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:37:05+00:00 (#5675)
item.description: yes, but a live snapshot right? (I mean I guess it has to be, if the machine isn't on hyperdbg can hardly be loaded heh)

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:36:49+00:00 (#5674)
item.description: The crash happens immediately after you load HyperDbg.

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:36:20+00:00 (#5672)
item.description: I mean a simple snapshot that restores the system to a state where HyperDbg is not loaded

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:35:34+00:00 (#5671)
item.description: and then retry that

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:35:24+00:00 (#5670)
item.description: a live snapshot you mean? with the host already waiting for the debugger to connect?

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:35:04+00:00 (#5669)
item.description: I'm just gonna see whether it crashes on your machine or not.

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:34:41+00:00 (#5668)
item.description: Ah, and can you create an snapshot from your VM and then try to load HyperDbg multiple times?

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:34:06+00:00 (#5667)
item.description: mine is 17.5.0

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:34:00+00:00 (#5666)
item.description: oh, yeah we are using quite different versions

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:33:51+00:00 (#5665)
item.description: So, maybe it's just me that encounter this issue

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:33:39+00:00 (#5664)
item.description: I just suspect maybe my VMware version is older than the latest release

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:33:14+00:00 (#5663)
item.description: and I'm hardly a vmware expert, so...

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:33:04+00:00 (#5662)
item.description: since I saw the same 'com2' example in the documentation

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:32:51+00:00 (#5661)
item.description: I think so too,, but just wondering

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:32:38+00:00 (#5660)
item.description: Yes, but that's probably unrelated to the issue ü§î

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:32:29+00:00 (#5659)
item.description: or did you assign it yourself - that's possible too of course

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:32:02+00:00 (#5658)
item.description: the only difference I see is that my VM's serial port is just COM1 - any particular reason why yours is COM2? is there another port already at this address in your VM?

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:31:39+00:00 (#5657)
item.description: I mean snapshot

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:31:32+00:00 (#5656)
item.description: and test it again and again

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:31:23+00:00 (#5655)
item.description: I just try to restore the VM

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:31:16+00:00 (#5654)
item.description: yeah

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:31:09+00:00 (#5653)
item.description: This is probably some other issues! ^_^

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:30:33+00:00 (#5652)
item.description: OK, this is what I did

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:30:21+00:00 (#5651)
item.description: my UM crash by the way - a stack overflow due to recursion in ShowMessages?

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:30:00+00:00 (#5650)
item.description: without any need to host interaction.

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:29:48+00:00 (#5649)
item.description:
but probably, the same error happens on
.connect local load vmm

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:29:30+00:00 (#5648)
item.description: On the guest: .debug prepare serial 115200 com2

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:29:19+00:00 (#5647)
item.description:
I'm just loading HyperDbg :
On the host:
.debug remote namedpipe \\.\pipe\HyperDbgPipe

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:28:26+00:00 (#5646)
item.description: I did get a crash on the very first .debug close just now, but that was a user mode crash in hyperdbg-cli.exe, not a VMware crash

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:27:42+00:00 (#5645)
item.description: what steps are you following exactly when you are doing this? just to make sure I'm actually attempting the same thing that generates this error for you

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:06:55+00:00 (#5644)
item.description: OK, I see

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:06:14+00:00 (#5643)
item.description: Exactly

item.title: @Nitr0_G on 2024-01-28 11:05:53+00:00 (#5642)
item.description: Yeah, we kind of discussed it. But it seems that we decided to solve this problem when RedDbg is relatively ready and if something is, then I can rewrite something.

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:04:24+00:00 (#5641)
item.description: it would only be to avoid having very divergent code bases eventually when one or the other is 'done'

item.title: @Nitr0_G on 2024-01-28 11:04:00+00:00 (#5640)
item.description: The work is going on. I'm redoing the architecture a bit now.

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:03:49+00:00 (#5639)
item.description: the branch would not need to be released necessarily

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:03:34+00:00 (#5638)
item.description: no, I understand that but neither is hyperdbg itself, right?

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:03:22+00:00 (#5637)
item.description: It's a work in progress.

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:03:07+00:00 (#5636)
item.description: It's not yet finished.

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:02:54+00:00 (#5635)
item.description: I never had an AMD laptop but it seems that at some point I have to buy and test it too.

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:02:31+00:00 (#5634)
item.description: is there a reason it's a separate repository and not e.g. a branch that can occasionally be used to merge shared features when they are finished?

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 11:02:02+00:00 (#5633)
item.description: There is also another project 'RedDbg' which is mainly designed for AMD that @Nitr0_G is working on it, but agree. The support for AMD is also necessary.

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:01:29+00:00 (#5632)
item.description: I saw there was a separate repo in the works with AMD support, but I haven't looked at it yet

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 11:00:32+00:00 (#5631)
item.description: given that I tend to buy AMDs for my workstations

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 10:59:46+00:00 (#5630)
item.description: I know this sounds cheeky by the way, but I have to be honest - I simply don't really have a use for a debugger that only works on intels

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 10:56:29+00:00 (#5629)
item.description: yep - I've read most of the docs by now, just haven't had time to try everything yet

item.title: @HughEverett on 2024-01-28 10:55:46+00:00 (#5628)
item.description:
Yes, HyperDbg also has a short-circuiting capability that makes it even better. https://docs.hyperdbg.org/tips-and-tricks/misc/event-short-circuiting
and event calling stages: https://docs.hyperdbg.org/tips-and-tricks/misc/event-calling-stage

item.title: @Mattiwatti on 2024-01-28 10:53:58+00:00 (#5627)
item.description: hey hey!
